text: Question ... I've been tasked with validating the HTML/CSS for a HubSpot site. When I run it through W3C validation (<https://validator.w3.org/>), I get a lot of errors. Is there another way to check it?
idk if it’s just me but I stopped honestly using the W3C validator a long while ago because it’s consistently behind the times
Do you have a link to the site you are running through it? We may be able to help assist with it and let you know if its things that are fixable or not

This the site > <http://innovativeclosetdesigns-5027975.hs-sites.com/> and here are the results from W3C Validation <https://validator.w3.org/nu/?doc=http%3A%2F%2Finnovativeclosetdesigns-5027975.hs-sites.com%2F> .  Hey <@U7SL518D6> - do you have an alternative you'd suggest?
<@UHW4M3E4S> These are coded templates correct? Have you tried using the `no_wrapper=True` param on your module includes? This should help fix the "Div in span" tag stuff

<@U2H3TT8F2> yes they are coded templates, but I did not create them. We were trying to see if there was an easy ways to check the code for errors. The only solution HubSpot support provided was to look for red in the code. That said, i'll try to add the no_wrapper=True as you suggest to see if that makes a difference.

how can I get alert message in HubL?
want whole querystring in alert
